intro: Pleurolobus canescens, commonly known as the hairy pleurolobus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands or grasslands. Its small, yellowish flowers are followed by pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
